name: Premier Inn Edinburgh Airport - Newbridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I recently stayed two nights in this hotel at a bargain rate,the hotel is relatively new and in first class order,decent room sizes,on the basic side but everything you need for a short stay,the only drawback is its about 10 miles from the city centre but you can get a bus at the park and ride just down the road near the airport,if you can put up with the bus ride into town this is a new hotel(look for the deals) with good food at reasonable prices. I never noticed any noise from the nearby road intersection or airport and would stay here again for the price paid,Edinburgh on a budget.
reviews.title: short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a new Premier Inn and as such has a new idea of a computerised check-in. Just put in your booking number, pay for any extras such as breakfast and your room key is dispensed by the machine. Call me old fashioned, but I prefer a smiling face greeting me from behind a desk rather than a receptionist who aimlessly ambles about a lobby.
reviews.title: Not as good as some Premier Inns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bedroom was what you would expect, clean, smart and modern. The bed, however, was too hard to be comfortable. Perhaps it just has not had time to wear in? The chair was seriously coming apart and was quickly replaced when I mentioned it to the wandering receptionist in the hotel lobby. Also, whilst we were there the weather was blowing a gale which made it even more unfortunate that one set of the lobby doors kept opening and closing at will.
reviews.title: One of the best budget hotels - don't let location put you off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The evening meal in the restaurant gave the impression that it was not accustomed to being so busy. They ran out of at least two menu options and the table next to us could not get a steak cooked to their liking despite the kitchen having two attempts. Meanwhile my steak was overcooked and was extremely tough (and I mean tough, not just chewy). I was offered another but preferred not to wait for it as there had already been a gap of thirty minutes between our first and second courses. Breakfast in the morning was satisfactory.
reviews.title: No frills but clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: One thing I do like about Premier Inns is the way they maintain the building. When we came down for breakfast, a member of staff was applying touch up paint to some marks on the wall near the lifts. This is a new small development so the address or post code do not work in the sat nav. Ring for directions.
reviews.title: Stayed here for the Edinburgh Tattoo, excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night prior to flying from Edinburgh Airport.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location easy to find just off Motorway junction situated on a commercial estate,large car park easy to park.
reviews.title: First Class stay at a fantastic price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Check in was by self check in terminals but plenty of helpful staff to take you through the process, which is by touch screen and really easy to follow, payment at end by pin card payment device which issues the receipt and room cards.
reviews.title: Hope you've got lots of time for dinner?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: General appearance of entrance and public ares good and very new and clean, access to lift and room by entry cards issued by the check in machine.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms very functional and clean, tea and coffee making facilities, also good air con and sealed windows that prevent outside noise from nearby motorway and airport.
reviews.title: Excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had planned a 2 night stay , but after a sleepless night on the first night ( due to a large amount of inconsiderate guests ) we complained, got a full refund and returned home early.
reviews.title: Would have rated higher....except BEWARE.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was the world karate championships being held in Edinburgh when we stayed, and there were LOADS of South African and South Korean guests ( of all ages ).
reviews.title: Budget price but great for a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When going to our room ( mid afternoon ) we had to fight our way through kids running up and down the long corridors in and out of each others rooms....* allowing the heavy doors to BANG behind themselves ( not bothering to use the handles to close the doors).
reviews.title: New Format

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This carried on well after 11:30 pm......and started again at 6:00am when they were getting ready.
reviews.title: Getting there - finding the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The staff were VERY apologetic, and dealt with our complaint in a professional manner.
reviews.title: Not the best place we have stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel very centrally located for the airport. Took just 10 minutes in the morning to get to the airport. We checked in quite late, not a problem, had the new express check in terminals which were easy to use, just follow the on screen instructions- very similar to the check in screens at the airport, but there was a member of staff on hand to give assiastance if required. Room was up to the normal standard you would expect the Premier Inn.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is in an Industrial Estate, don't let that put you off, it's easy to find,it's quiet, would use this hotel again for the aiport.
reviews.title: Good place to wake up when catching a flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a great budget hotel with all the important aspects of a clean, well appointed hotel room. It is located near the airport, which is why we selected it.
reviews.title: Good all round quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here prior to an early morning flight to Dublin the next day and as usual a good all round service provided by the Premier Inn chain at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Check-in was swift using the new express check-in terminals (guidance given by staff) and quality of rooms were very good.
reviews.title: A Proper Hotel

aka: Premier Inn Edinburgh Airport (Newbridge) Hotel Edinburgh
